lines.text: They'll never catch me... because I'm fucking innocent.
Which part of Mexico are you from?
Paraguay.
Wha - why is there tape on your nose?
Exactly!
go!
Well, I think there's a real air of mystery about me.
Don't complicate it. Your number one strength is you have a car you can provide. Sell yourself! Start over. Ready, go!
Okay, alright. I'm a risk taker! I'm growin' an entire crop of marijuana plants in my parents back yard! I think that shows...
Wait, you're growing an entire crop of marijuana in your back yard?
Dignan, look. I'm just not very good at this selling-yourself stuff, okay? So, I'm just gonna tell you the truth. I really wanna be a part of this team. And I'm the only one with a car.
That's good. That's good. 'Cause that hits me right here.
Man, I blew it. I blew it, man.
Kumar, what were you doing in the freezer?
I don't know, man, I lose my touch, man.
Did you ever have a touch to lose, man?

Anthony, I need to talk to you, man... Anthony, I have got to talk to you! Look, I am sorry about this, this seems like a nice soiree, but I have got a family situation. I don't care what you think. I dont care! Tengo una situación con mi familia! Dignan does not want to deal with it, could you please come outside for a minute?
On the run from Johnny Law... ain't no trip to Cleveland.
A bigger bag, you idiot!
Don't call me an idiot, you punk!
Can... do you have a... do you have bigger bags... for atlases or dictionaries... uhh, Sir?
Jack, I'm 26 years old, I didn't run away from home.
[last lines]
Ain't it funny how you used to be in the nut house and now I'm in jail?
Grace thinks I'm a failure.
What? What has she ever accomplished in her life that's so great?
How does an asshole like Bob get such a great kitchen?
I don't mean to offend you, Bob. But your brother's a cocksucker. Does that offend you?
No, that didn't offend me.
Good.
Who tripped the alarm, man?
It's the fire alarm!
Who tripped the fire alarm?
IT'S BECAUSE OF ALL THIS FUCKING SMOKE!
Tell Anthony I love him.
He looks at me and says, "Bob, just because you're a fuckup doesn't mean you're not my brother."

What a lemon! One minute it's running like a top, and the next it's broken down on the side of the road. And I can't fix a car like this, because I don't have the tools! And even if I did have the tools I don't know if I could fix a car like this!
Okay. There, you see the star is me, right there, and I'll be in there. The X is Anthony. Bob, you're the zero out here in the car.
So, did you enjoy your first visit to the nut house?
Hey, hey, shh, shh, shh. Come on. Be sensitive to the fact that other people are not comfortable talking about emotional disturbances. Um, you know, I am, I'm fine with that, but... other people.
Pointless act! You don't give a 500 dollar tip to the housekeeper! That's inappropriate! That's inexcusable! That, I don't forgive! What were you thinking? What were you thinking?
Hey, you're in the Army, yes?
No, I just have short hair.

One morning, over at Elizabeth's beach house, she asked me if I'd rather go water-skiing or lay out. And I realized that not only did I not want to answer THAT question, but I never wanted to answer another water-sports question, or see any of these people again for the rest of my life.
Can I get you guys something to drink?
Uh yeah, I'll have a Tom Collins.
dynamite, pole vaulting, laughing gas, choppers - can you see how incredible this is going to be? - hang gliding, come on!
So is Mr. Henry coming to se me or...
Well, I don't think so Dignan. He actually robbed Bob's house.
You're kidding! Wow. I almost robbed that place myself.
You know, Johnathan, the world needs dreamers.
Excuse me?

No, I don't think so. You know, John, one day I believe that you're going to wake up and realize you no longer have a brother. And you no longer have any friends. And on that day I'm gonna be standing front and center just laughing my fucking head off.

[laughs]
John!
[continues laughing]
John!

I think I know what you've been going through, man, cos I've been through some heavy shit myself. If you feel alone, like nobody in the world cares and nobody in the fucking world gives a shit, then I'm here...
...That was a stop sign man...
I'm ready to listen, man. If you want, I'll even open up first. I mean, my brother, that's a shit situation y'know, I mean he beats the crap outta me all the time.
It was... It was - it's landscaping, not just mowing.
Hey man, don't listen to that guy.
I don't know, sometimes I... I mean I'm not always as confident as I look.
Did you see what he had on?
Yeah, it was pretty cool.

[translating for Inez]
You're like paper. You know, you're trash.
Like trash?
You know, you're like paper falling by, you know... It doesn't sound that bad in Spanish...
You've never worked a day in your life. How can you be exhausted?
I don't expect you to be as depressed as I am. But I don't think your happiness is quite appropriate.
I do have one bit of advice for you though. Take the time in school to learn a foreign language.
Why are you here right now? You're always at lunch at this time!
Not always.
Yes! Always!

What do you think I was doing the whole time you were out there man? I told you Dignan got fired, out on his ass. But you didn't think about that, did you. In the end it's easier to think about yourself than it is to think about Dignan.
Maybe we should've robbed your house. You ever think of that?
You know there's nothing to steal from my mom and Craig!

[points to Bob]
He's out.
[points to Anthony]
And you're out, too. And I dont think I'm in, either. No gang!

We'll get him. We'll get him. Man, dont worry about that, we'll get him. And when we do, we'll blow up his car, do something. I can guarantee you that. What makes me furious is thinking about the look on Bob's fat face, thinking he pulled one over on us. I tell you another thing. If our paths cross again, you're gonna see a side of Dignan that you havent seen before. A sick, sadistic side, cause I'm furious at Bob.
Wow, you're really complicated.
I try not to be.
You told, you told your friend Bernice I'm some kind of jet pilot?
What was I supposed to say, they stuck you in an insane asylum?
It wasn't an insane asylum, Grace. I explained to you back then that it was for exhaustion.
Exhaustion?
Yes, exhaustion.
You haven't worked a day in your life. How could you be exhausted?
Dignan, the picture's not doing it for me right now.
Well does the fact that I'm trying to do it do it for you?
You, my dear friend, are a damn fool.
When are you coming home?
I can't come home, Grace, I'm an adult.
I don't suppose either one of you know why Bob's car is here?
Uh... yeah, he's *here*.
Who'd you get to do that? Did you bribe a janitor?
Why aren't you over there right now?
Because we're fugitives... and he fired me.
I don't think your happiness is quite appropriate.
Son of a bitch! Anthony! Anthony! Bob's gone. He stole his car! He flew the coop while we were sleepin'!
Little kids are really cute. She is a cute little kid.

[Bob is arguing with his brother]
Bullying son of a bitch!
You're calling me a bully? Here's a bully for you!
[punches Bob]
Who's that man?
That's Applejack, come on Kumar!
I'm paying attention.
GODDAMNIT! Your not paying attention if you're messin' around with the gun!
How's the water? How's the water?
Hey Anthony, don't try to save everybody, okay?

[stops playing pinball]
You took the earrings, Dignan? You took em.
[leaves the drug store]
Well, you know, it's my fault. It's like, ultimately, Anthony, when are you gonna learn?
Man, you got another ball. Should I play your game?

[outside]
The list, Dignan. I know you remember the list cause you signed it. You signed the things Dignan's not supposed to touch.
The thing is I can't be sorting through all that shit in the middle of a burglary.
Hey, hey, I don't care, okay? I bought the earrings for my mother on her birthday. I went down, I picked em out myself.
Hey, one thing is, every valuable item in the house was on that list.
Hey, maybe, we should've robbed your house. Did you ever think of that? No, I bet that never crossed your mind.
Let's get lucky.
[first lines]
Hey, Dr Nichols, I was just coming down to say goodbye...
I learned more in the 2 months I spent with Mr. Henry and this crew than I learned in 15 years of academic study.
Everybody wants to know what's next. May I enjoy this moment?
